body:
Whenever I send a message to myself, I can get a notify by the server that the message is correctly sent, but I don't get any notify that the message was received.

So as long as i'm testing, message queue piles up and every time I connect, I randomly receive my messages (marked as 'unreceived'), and sometimes older messages are discarded

...dig dig dig...

I found out that I don't send out the ack to my own messages
(thanks to https://github.com/davidgfnet/whatsapp-purple/issues/18#issuecomment-23104918 )

It was easy to comment line 
https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/blob/master/src/php/whatsprot.class.php#L1697
and substitute with

```php
                    if (true	
```

this saved my day, messages got acked upon next connection and queue is finally empty.

One question, why should I not ack the messages sent to myself ? ( I bet a lot of people are doing this for testing purpose and are/were puzzled like me)
title: Message to myself are not acked
